dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a beautiful 40-YEAR-OLD WOMAN at the helm of a powerful SPEEDBOAT -- her hair tossed back by the wind, h mouth in a euphoric grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My missionary ancestors came to the islands and told the Hawaiians to put on clothes, work hard, believe in Christ, and stop surfing and hula dancing. They made business deals along the way -- buying an island, or marrying a princess and inheriting her land. Now their descendants wear bikinis and running shorts, play beach volleyball and surf, and take up hula dancing. Hawai'i has always been a place of contradiction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VARIOUS SHOTS of Honolulu begin a pattern of montages to interspersed throughout the film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friends on the mainland think just because I live in Hawai'i, I live in paradise. Like a permanent vacation -- we're all just out here drinking mai- tais, shaking our hips, and catching waves. Are they nuts? How can they possibly think our families are less screwed up, our heart attacks and cancers less fatal, our grief less devastating? Hell, I haven't been on a surfboard in fifteen years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ZOOM BACK from a panorama of Honolulu to find 50-year- MATT KING seated amid DOCUMENTS atop a makeshift desk -- has brought his work with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the last 23 days, I've been living in a "paradise" of IVs and urine bags and endotracheal tubes and six-month- old US magazines. Paradise. Paradise can go fuck itself. Matt looks up at the WOMAN we saw in the speedboat, now l stiffly on an upright HOSPITAL BED, her head cocked to on side, a feeding tube in her nose, a ventilator in her trachea, IVs in her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Elizabeth King, my wife. Twenty-three days ago she was launched from a powerboat during a race and hit her head, almost drowned. Now she's in a coma that scores 5 on the Glasgow scale and 3 on the Rancho Los Amigos scale, scores showing an extremely severe coma. Liz is very competitive. Whatever she does, she does to the fullest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt is getting the current DIAGNOSIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reacts non-purposefully to stimuli in a non-specific manner, but occasionally her responses are specific, though inconsistent. Her reflexes are primitive and often the same, regardless of stimuli presented...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was exactly what Elizabeth used to accuse me of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt continues to observe her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-three days in a coma, and any day now the doctors will give me their final verdict if she's going to come out of it or not. Then I have a decision to make. Wait, that's wrong. Liz has a living will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like always, she makes her own decisions. But I know she's going to pull through. His CELLPHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Noe, what's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt, you have a call from Scottie's teacher. She says it's urgent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. Put her on.

dialogues.speaker: A SCRAPBOOK
dialogues.text: shows PHOTOS OF ELIZABETH lying in her hospital bed. The compositions are odd, the ANGLES uncomfortably CLOSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt confers with fifth-grade teacher MS. Hayashi and sch counselor MRS. THULL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just don't think these photographs are appropriate for Scottie to be sharing with her classmates. Some of them went home quite disturbed, and we got some angry calls from parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she's sort of been going to town with the whole picture-taking thing, but I had no idea --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you how my heart goes out to you and your family, but Scottie just hasn't been herself. Principal Cruz agrees with us that it maybe would be better for Scottie to remain at home with you during this difficult time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home. See, I would think that sticking to her normal routine would be the best thing for her -- you know, keep her occupied. I wouldn't really know how to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants          PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Dr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I've kind of got my hands full. And her sister's away at school on the Big Island. I don't think Scottie would really want to hang out with me when she could be with her friends and people like you who specialize in children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. King, we see this every day -- children acting out at school when something's wrong at home. And your family is facing a devastating crisis. Have you been engaging Scottie in really talking about what's going on? Encouraging her to express her feelings? That's crucial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (No)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah.   Yeah.   Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This shit is bananas. B-a-n-a-n-a-s. This shit is bananas. They look over to see --

dialogues.speaker: TEN-YEAR-OLD SCOTTIE KING --
dialogues.text: EARBUDS in place and in her own world, DANCING just outsi the classroom door. A JANITOR down the hall eyes her suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This shit is bananas. B-a-n-a-n-a-s! Matt stares aghast at this specimen called his daughter. ladies glance between Scottie and Matt, wondering when, o whether, he'll intervene. Finally --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie, that is not a good choice! Are you making a good choice? Scottie remains oblivious.       Ms. Hayashi rises to her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Scottie, come on.     Knock it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants     PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt leads Scottie to the car. MATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with you? Showing those pictures of Mom for your art project? SCOTTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a photographer, Dad, a real photographer. MATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not. You're overdoing it is what you're doing. SCOTTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw it in a book. Some famous photographer lady took pictures of her mom in the hospital while she was dying, and they're considered art. That's what I'm doing. MATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First of all, your mother's very sick, but she's not dying. Second, you don't share personal stuff like that with strangers. What's going on with Mom is private. SCOTTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hungry. Can we get burgers? MATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. SCOTTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we get smoothies? MATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. As Scottie continues -- MATT (V.O.) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last time I took care of Scottie by myself was when she was one. Now she's ten, and I have no idea what goes on inside her head. She's insane. And with Elizabeth in the hospital, I think she's testing me. I'm the backup parent. The understudy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants      PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH!   Scottie takes Elizabeth's picture again. MATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you'd stop doing that. And rather than taking her picture all the time, you should talk to her. I'm tired of asking you. You heard Dr. Johnston -- people in a coma can hear you -- you know, well, some of them can. It lets them know they're still loved, might even help them wake up sooner. And it'll help you express whatever feelings and emotions you're supposed to be going through -- you know, make you feel better. SCOTTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to say. MATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her a story. SCOTTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a story. MATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her anything. Tell her what's been going on in school. SCOTTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She never cares about that. MATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe that. What about after school? She's always driving you around the island. You know, gymnastics? Soccer? SCOTTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't do those things anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ballet?   Piano?   Hula?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. MATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're not going to say anything to your mother, we might as well leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants          PINK Shooting Draft      4/11/10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about this?    Write her a letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would I write?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. "Get well. Wake up. I love you. Don't leave me alone with my idiot Dad."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's she going to read it?         She's in a coma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Scottie, stop fighting me on everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it doesn't make any sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what your mother is hearing right now? You refusing to talk to her. Is that what you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm starving. And I'm thirsty.          I want a soda. He takes Scottie by the hand and sits her down in a chair next to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not leaving until you talk to her. I'll even give you privacy. Recite her the alphabet for all I care. What do you want to drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sprite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, Sprite. Diet Sprite?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not diet.    Regular.   Do you think I'm fat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not fat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not the model.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just that all that sugar makes you cranky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not cranky!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.     I'll be right back.    Talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Matt steps out into the hallway, he passes NURSE JOY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. King, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, Joy, fine.     And you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see your picture in the paper today. Have you made your decision yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My decision?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your family. About your big land. The other NURSE nudges Joy to be more polite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?     Me and Mr. King, we're like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's not really my decision. It's my whole family's decision. And furthermore... (mock scolding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... mind your own business, young lady. As he turns away to continue down the hall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft      4/11/10 Dr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole goddamned state is following my decision on who's going to buy 35,000 acres on Kaua'i my family has owned since the 1860s. My cousins and I meet in six days to approve a buyer. Ever since my father died nine years ago, I'm the sole trustee, the controlling trustee, so I hold all the cards. Why does so much have to depend on me -- my wife, my daughters, my family's land? I just want to hide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POSTCARD shows a BEAUTIFUL YOUNG GIRL in a bikini straddling a surfboard, laughing as she's splashed. Barely containing his rage, Matt stares at postcard befor grabbing ALL THE POSTCARDS in that rack.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE COUNTER --
dialogues.text: About to pay for the postcards and two SODAS, Matt notice HEADLINE atop a stack of NEWSPAPERS: "Activists Continue Protest of Kaua'i Sale."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, they all the same cards.      You like buy all the same cards?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are inappropriate for a hospital gift shop. This girl is underage. Why do you sell postcards like this? This is a hospital. These aren't get-well cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHOPKEEPER blinks at the man weirdly accosting her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like buy all the cards?       Or you want I put them back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling out his wallet) Never mind. Yes, I'm buying them.          And these two sodas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she rings him up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you buy underage girl all for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the lobby just outside the store, he drops the stack o postcards into the GARBAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgoing the elevator -- perhaps to squeeze in a little exercise -- Matt trudges upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth's going to make it out okay. I know it. It's not her time yet. She'll wake up, Scottie and Alexandra will have their mother back, and we'll talk about our marriage. I'll sell the land and quit my practice and buy her whatever she wants -- a big boat, a house in France, a trip around the world, just the two of us. We'll get close again, like the early days. It's still in us. It must be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approaching the door, Matt hears LAUGHTER from inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt enters to find Scottie on a sofa in the corner GIGGL and TEXTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hungry. Can we go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't talk to her, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you tell her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's private.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants         PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Dra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lying. And Jesus Christ, enough with the goddamn texting! Give me that phone! Give it here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie fights him as he snatches her phone away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Scottie. Okay, you win.       Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie springs up out of the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie bolts out the door. Matt takes a last look at Liz panic and sadness rippling across his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife -- the sportswoman, the model, the drinker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you please wake up already?      I need you. I can't do this alone.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Images lead us up the PALI HIGHWAY and into the lush old neighborhood of NU'UANU.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This STATELY OLD HOUSE shows signs of neglect but feels impressive and welcoming nonetheless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this Barb Higgins?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Matt King returning your call. I assume your daughter is a classmate of my daughter's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft     4/11/10 Dr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Lani is a classmate of Scottie's, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Matt speaks on the PHONE, he wanders out of his clutte HOME OFFICE and into the DINING ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see, where to start? It's Scottie. She's been texting some awful things to Lani, and I'd like her to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For instance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the latest one. "We all know you grew pubes over the summer." She sends little messages like that for no reason. She even wrote it on Lani's Facebook wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She calls my daughter Lanikai, implying she's like the size of an entire neighborhood. Do you think that's nice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not like her at all.       She's usually very sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances out the window at Scottie, who sits on the gro back turned, POUNDING something with a BIG ROCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you may know, her mother isn't well, and maybe this is how she's dealing with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care about the backstory, Mr. King. My daughter comes home from school in tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, no, I get it.    I'm very sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie should be the one who's sorry. I want her to come over and apologize to Lani, and I don't ever want her to write to my daughter again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can in a good way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she doesn't apologize, I'm going to tell the headmaster. You can't buy your way out of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt draws a long exasperated breath, as if everything el weren't enough already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See what I mean? Everybody sees me as the rich guy, the inheritor. People resent us. I resent us. Even our last name -- King. How irritating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt drives Scottie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to say you're sorry, and you need to mean it. No dicking around. I have a ton of work to do tonight. Do you have any idea how behind I am? You made her cry. Why would you want to be so mean to someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated) I don't know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you text all the time, nasty things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I write them with Reina. They make her laugh, and then she shows Megan and Brooke, and they laugh too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have known Reina had something to do with it. I don't want you hanging out with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, I told Reina she could visit me in the hospital since I'm not in school anymore. Can she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll make a deal. You apologize to this girl, and you talk to your mother, and then we'll see about Reina dropping by the hospital. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something outside the window catches Scottie's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt looks to see --

dialogues.speaker: SIX FAMILY MEMBERS,
dialogues.text: walking on the sidewalk with KAYAKS, wearing T-SHIRTS rea "Melnick Family Reunion."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie, knock it off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie sits back in her seat, laughing. Matt glances in rearview mirror to see a TEENAGE SON taking off his T-shi and throwing it to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car drives down a block of MODEST HOMES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her house is down there on the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been here before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft    4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea-uh. She invites me to her birthday, like, every year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you guys are actually friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until last year's party, when she locked me out of the house and I had to sit outside all day while everybody was inside. She thought she was so great, but then I became friends with Reina and Brooke and got popular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (processing) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARB HIGGINS answers the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for coming by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Matt and Scottie are shown inside, they remove their shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot to mention the time Scottie said she didn't want to be Lani's partner at the rock wall because she didn't want to fall into my daughter's butt crack. That doesn't even make sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barb now leads them into --

dialogues.speaker: THE TV ROOM --
dialogues.text: -- where LANI HIGGINS sits on a couch.        Matt is imp be done with this meaningless task.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie, do you have something you want to say to Lani?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants           PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Well, nice meeting you both. Lani, you should come over sometime. Come for a swim or a hike or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie, the things you said were simply evil. Do you realize that? I don't know what's led you to be such a nasty young lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey. We came over. She apologized. We're dealing with it. Kids are mean sometimes. They grow out of it. It's a kid thing. Here, Scottie, you're going to stop, right? And you're really, really sorry, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie makes a big exaggerated nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think she's sorry at all. She's going to keep doing it. I can tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she won't. It's like the time Lani locked Scottie out of the house at her birthday party and Scottie sat outside by herself. It was a mean thing to do, but Lani here probably did it just to show off, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lani thinks a moment, nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm not about to declare that one action defines a human being's entire character. She's a work in progress, and like all complex people is a bundle of contradictions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You brought me cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants     PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You brought her cake. So, I don't know, maybe Lani should be the one to apologize, since this incident may have been the catalyst for all this... "evil" was the word you used.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens, and Matt and Scottie pause to slip their shoes back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and Mr. King?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck with the sale. Matt turns to look at her.    So that's what all this was on some level?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say your decision will have a major impact on Hawai'i's real estate world, not to mention the whole landscape of Kaua'i. Hundreds of millions of dollars, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My husband's family is from Kaua'i. Hanapepe, born and bred. They hope you don't sell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the traffic it's going to make. Matt and Scottie walk away.   Barb closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to act different with Lani?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft    4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try, but it's hard. She has a face you just want to hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera makes its way past PHOTOS of Matt's ancestors, BOOKS of Hawaiian history, other family memorabilia to fi Matt at his desk pouring over PAPERS. A clock reads 1:20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My great-great-grandmother was Princess Margaret Ke'alohilani, one of the last direct descendants of King Kamehameha. She was originally supposed to marry her hanai brother, but she fell in love with her haole banker and estate manager, Edward King, whose parents were missionaries. Between his land deals and her huge inheritance, all of their descendants for generations have watched the past unfurl millions into our laps through leases and sales. Now the Rule Against Perpetuities is forcing us to dissolve the trust, and we're selling the last parcel of undeveloped land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt looks up, his glance falling on the portraits of Edw and Margaret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon my daughters and I can just be normal citizens like everybody else, and these dead people will stop controlling our lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to be a normal guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing -- tall buildings, business people, lunch wagons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants     PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt eats a SACK LUNCH at his desk. His window has a gran view of DOWNTOWN. We glimpse his Punahou, college and law school DIPLOMAS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unlike a lot of my cousins, I haven't touched my share of the trust money. Like my father before me, I live only on the income from my law practice. I don't want my daughters growing up entitled and spoiled. And I agree with my father -- you give your children enough money to do something but not enough to do nothing. Matt's secretary NOE cracks open his door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. King, your cousins are here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt enters the room to find SEVEN COUSINS waiting to gre him. From their casual clothing and shaggy hair, an obser might hardly suspect their status.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not only am I the sole but I'm a commercial real estate and transactional attorney, so the most involved of my cousins have been meeting with me regularly to analyze the bids -- Cousin Dave, Cousin Hal, Cousin Six, Cousin Wink, Cousin Lisa, Cousin Connie and Cousin Stan, both of whom oppose the sale entirely. Don't be fooled by appearances. In Hawai'i some of the most powerful people look like bums and stuntmen.

dialogues.speaker: LATER --
dialogues.text: Matt and his cousins stand above the conference table, looking at blueprints and architectural drawings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The proposals are virtually the same -- hotels, shopping centers, condos and golf courses. 3000 new jobs in the first five years. Support letters from the construction industry and unions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants         PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Dra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Chicago group is offering half a billion dollars, but we're leaning toward a lower bid from a guy named Don Holitzer. He's actually from Kaua'i and made a fortune in Silicon Valley. Cousin Hugh is pushing us in that direction, and I say why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON MATT, nodding along but highly distracted, the s of Liz's VENTILATOR growing louder in his brain. We CUT TO ARTIST'S RENDERINGS of comatose Elizabeth -- wi closer, closer still, closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing.       Matt walks inside the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt sits across from old family friend DR. SAM JOHNSTON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad news, Matt. Dr. Chun, Dr. Mueller and I -- we believe her condition, which we call a multi-factorial anoxic encephalopathy, is deteriorating. We see no eye movement, no pupillary response, basically no brainstem reflexes whatsoever. The machines could keep her going, but her quality of life would be... very poor. Basically what you see now. She'll never be like she was, Matt. Never. We know that now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt sits very still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you how sorry I am to have to tell you this. And you have your daughters. There's just nothing we can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... if we do go ahead and take her off the machines --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if, Matt. When. I have a legal obligation. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long will she last?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to say. Could be a few days. Could be two weeks. But for planning purposes, you should work off the shortest possible scenario. I know I need to get the ball rolling on organ donations right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Organ donation?     Forgot about that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth has so many friends, a big life. Last time I was at your house, must have been 200 people. If you're going to let people know to say goodbye, which is fairly typical protocol in these situations, start now. By the time the last day comes, they feel more ready, as ready as they can feel. I'm so sorry, Matt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His mind spinning, Matt prepares to look at the corpse-to When he opens the door and pulls back the curtain, he fin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- friends MARK AND KAI MITCHELL up for a visit. They're playing MUSIC for Elizabeth on a mini-boombox, and Kai is APPLYING MAKE-UP to Liz's face. After cheery greetings --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, she's been looking a little pale lately all cooped up in here, and I just know she'd be mortified if no one had thought to help her out with some lipstick and blush. I know she'll grill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt and Mark exchange a look -- "Girls."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And of course Kai's getting her all caught up on all the latest gossip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't want to have to start from scratch later. Oh, and Matt, on the way here we stopped by and left some more meals in your fridge, all ready to nuke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt smiles -- he'd been expecting a grim moment alone wi Elizabeth, but instead he finds a room full of warmth and life. Even if it's a little creepy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the latest anyway, Matt?    Any updates?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. Just more of the same -- monitoring the swelling, keeping her kidneys and other vitals working, you know, hoping for the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kai nods sympathetically before turning back to Elizabeth EXTREME CLOSEUP of Liz's lips as Kai applies lipstick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOGGERS go past as Matt's car pulls into the driveway of OCEAN OUTRIGGER CLUB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt lies on the beach watching Scottie play in the surf with her snorkel mask on. The melancholy he feels makes h regard his weird little daughter with tenderness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emerging from the water) I'm hungry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else is new?   Let's get you something to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie pops two last FRIES into her mouth, then turns he attention to a strawberry SUNDAE. Anxious to spoil her, Matt watches Scottie dig in. remains preoccupied, his smile distant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants          PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Dr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The food here at the club is so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they do a good job here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is it called a jellyfish?      It's not a fish, and it's not jelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No idea. You ask good questions. You're getting too smart for me, Scottie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to find out. Then I'm going to ask Mom when she wakes up and see if she knows. Do you think she's going to know everything she used to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt notices a BUFF GUY and some FRIENDS headed to a near table, and his mood sours. Scottie follows his gaze. The guy notices the Kings and feels obliged to mosey over This is TROY COOK -- athletic and rich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Matt.    Hi, Scottie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his friends) I'll catch up to you guys in a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt stares so intensely that Troy averts his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, uh, what's going on?      I mean, how's Elizabeth doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I visited her last week, you know.      I thought she looked pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why'd you ask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants     PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I just wanted to know the latest. I'm praying for her every day, you guys. Really hard. Seriously. So what I was saying was, when I was there, I talked to her, and her hand moved, so I was pretty encouraged. I thought that was an encouraging sign. Scottie looks up hopefully.   Matt notices. MATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really think she heard me. MATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Troy, go to your friends. No hard feelings. Let's just leave it alone. Troy walks away, stops, turns back. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, Matt, there were lots of chops and holes that day. I told you a hundred times. Ask anybody. What happened to her could have happened to me. It was a super-hard day on the water. MATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't supposed to be driving, Troy. She was supposed to be driving. TROY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wanted me to drive. And she's the one who told me to pass the other boat right before the turn. And just your whole attitude toward me, Matt -- I mean, I feel terrible. I wish it were me and not her. Plus I almost drowned myself when we capsized. And my rotator cuff is never going to be the same, and I'm going to miss Moloka'i. SCOTTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just because her hand moved, it doesn't mean anything, Troy. Mom twitches at weird times.   When you cut off a chicken's head, it runs all around, but it's still a dead chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Scottie pushes back from the table and takes off toward t pool. Matt follows, not even gracing Troy with a final lo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt catches up to Scottie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, sport, don't pay any attention to that guy. That guy's a dope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to say dead chicken. I don't want Mom to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know. Hey, let's get out of here. Let's go do something crazy. Like let's drive to the airport and hop over to the Big Island and surprise your sister. What do you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be fun. She's not expecting us or anything. And we bring her home. I think she should be here with us, don't you? Don't you miss her? I miss her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm out of school.       She should be too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Matt and Scottie head toward the exit, Scottie FLIPS O crestfallen Troy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Hawaiian Airlines inter-island airplane takes off.

dialogues.speaker: MAP OF THE ISLANDS
dialogues.text: A DOTTED LINE goes from Honolulu to Kona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt and Scottie look out the window at THE BIG ISLAND co into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somehow it feels natural to find a daughter of mine on a different island. A family seems exactly like an archipelago -- all part of the same geographic expression but still islands -- separate and alone, always drifting slowly apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RED RENTAL CAR zooms along the famous road near Kona traversing rocky -- almost lunar -- landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt looks over at Scottie, dozing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car turns onto the bumpy gravel road snaking through campus of this BOARDING SCHOOL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt knocks on a door.     An exhausted Scottie slouches a wall. The DORM SUPERVISOR appears in a nightgown.          The the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, sorry to bother you.       I'm Matt King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, hello, Mr. King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've come to pick up my daughter, Alexandra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you call Administration?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I didn't. It's sort of an emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft     4/11/10 Dra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, let's see what we can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie runs down the hall, excited by the idea of surpri her sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which door? Which door is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie, keep it down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you both keep it down?      It's around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn down another corridor, and Scottie knocks on a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the wrong door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens, and a girl pokes her head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back to sleep, Yuki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Yuki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dorm supervisor knocks on an adjacent door.         A later a ROOMMATE opens, groggy from sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake your roommate, sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing in her room) Um... Alex isn't here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she's... outside somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A coat over her nightgown, flashlight in hand, the dorm supervisor leads Matt and Scottie across glistening moist grass. They hear LAUGHTER. TWO FIGURES grow more distinct in the moonlight -- GIRLS hitting golf balls -- ALEXANDRA KING and friend EMILY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls! What do you think you're doing out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Alex!    It's me, Scottie! Emily takes off but doesn't get far -- she falls flat on face, golf club in one hand, BOTTLE in the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I pay $25,000 year for this crap not to happen. Alex!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad? (laughing, to Emily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My fucking dad is here! This cracks her up even more.      Scottie laughs too, th she's unsure why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't talk like that here.      This is unacceptable behavior!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come out to play a few holes with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We came to get you so you can come home. He took me out of school already. I haven't gone for three whole days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants         PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Dra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Matt) What's happening? Why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to come home and see Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexandra hears this, takes a few strides, flings her gol club into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I say about the language?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it about me that makes women in my life want to destroy themselves? Elizabeth with her motorcycles and speedboats and alcoholism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt's car arrives back home, and he and Scottie get out the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexandra with her drugs and older guys and modeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt carries a passed-out Alex upstairs.         Scottie ahead, opening the door to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- where Matt places Alex on her bed, takes off her shoes covers her with a blanket, and watches this tsunami of a at rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the stove, Matt dishes out SCRAMBLED EGGS.         Sco in the kitchen nook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Scottie, how can I protect her from... me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As he brings her plate over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you say so before I made them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought they were for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex trudges in and pulls a Coca-Cola out of the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning. (no answer) Does Mom let you have Coke for breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pretty sure it's after eleven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that we get a closer look, we might recognize Alexand from the postcards at the hospital. We also see a resemblance to her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrugging, she plops down near Scottie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hungover, huh? Why am I not surprised? I don't know where to start, and we probably shouldn't in front of Scottie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were supposed to be getting your act together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have gotten my act together. I was just drinking. I've been doing really well, but nobody ever seems to notice my grades are better, and how I was in that stupid play you guys didn't bother to see. Do you even remember the name of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It's on the tip of his tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I thought. So what if I got drunk on the ONE night you happened to drop in? So the fuck what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, hey. Watch your language in front of Scottie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting with them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, it's good to see you.      Welcome home. Want some eggs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long do I have to stay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll discuss that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going swimming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'll join you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt walks out the patio doors. Seated on the steps of th shallow end, Alexandra is on her cellphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go. I'll see you later. (to Matt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pool's really dirty. What day does the pool guy come? Matt notices all the floating leaves and insects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes... you know, I don't know what day he comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants             PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt grabs a POLE to skim the surface of the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid's coming over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Sid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A really good friend from Punahou.         We were in school together for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.    Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to be there for me with all this shit happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt wonders his own version of "What am I, chopped liver

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I know his parents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   He might stay over too.         Is that cool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, Scottie runs out onto the patio dressed in a B AND PANTIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck? Get out of my underwear, you freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooo, la la! Don't I look divine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie, get back inside and change into your swimsuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie flips him off and runs back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ALEXANDRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real good job you're doing. MATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's part of why I brought you here. You have to help me. I don't know what to do with her. Alexandra slides into the water, swims to the other side props herself on the edge, floating her lower body. Matt lowers himself into the water too. ALEXANDRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if you spent more time with her, she wouldn't act like such a complete spaz. Get her out of town -- go camp on Kaua'i. That's what mom did with me whenever I was losing it. MATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Alex, your mother isn't well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously. MATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just told me she isn't going to wake up. It's for sure now. The doctors are going to stop caring for her. Do you understand what I'm saying? Your mom wanted it this way. Alex remains silent. MATT (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has a will, see, saying we have to do it like this. We both do. That's why I got you. We're letting her go. Alex looks at him, takes a couple quick, loud inhalations then slips --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- where she SWIMS, FACE CONTORTED, hoping to stay down t forever. Finally she emerges --

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE THE POOL --
dialogues.text: -- and gets out, grabbing a towel, crying now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you have to tell me in the goddamned pool? Matt climbs out and approaches her, arms extended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex... Alex...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want? Matt drops his arms, crestfallen.       Alex scoffs, walk into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit together now on sofas.       Alexandra appears d from crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just found out yesterday. We have to go through this thing together, you and Scottie and I. And I need to go around and tell people what's happening -- our family and close friends. Sometimes I'll want you to come with me. Other times I need you to watch Scottie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to go around with you and tell everyone that Mom's going to die? What's the point of that? Breaking the news, watching them cry, dealing with their emotions. How depressing is that going to be? Just call them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex, nobody wants to do any of this. But we need to tell Grandpa and Tutu, a few friends. They have the right to know and to be able to say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about Mom with anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you fought about with her at Christmas, you need to drop it. Grow up. You love your mother. Your mother loves you. Move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft     4/11/10 Dr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't drop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really don't have a clue, do you? Dad, she was cheating on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what we fought about. When I was home at Christmas, I caught her with some guy. It made me sick to see her near you. I went back to school thinking that was it, I was done with her. I was going to call and tell you everything. But then the accident happened, and I was waiting until she woke up, I guess. And you, you didn't even suspect. Right? (off his silence) That disgusted me too. You're always so busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caught her with some guy?    What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brandy and I were on our way to swim in the Black Point pool, and suddenly I see Mom and some douchebag walk into a house. His house, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a guy? It could have been anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had his hand on her ass.      It was gross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure it was her. (off her nod) Then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then nothing. She went into the house. A few days later I told her I knew what she was doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First she acted like she didn't know what I was talking about. Like I'm blind. Then she got super-mad and started yelling at me and denied it. That's when I decided I didn't want anything more to do with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Some guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark hair. Matt stands up, walks in a little circle -- he literally not know which way to turn. Then he knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch Scottie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt bursts out of his house and starts RUNNING down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt comes sprinting around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt arrives at his neighbors' house and lets himself in kitchen door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt passes through the kitchen into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants          PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Dr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello!    It's me, Matt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARK AND KAI appear at the top of the stairs looking as though they haven't been downstairs all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, Matt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys weren't sleeping, were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they come downstairs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we were just fighting. Come on in. Want a drink? Want some coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) What were you fighting about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not stupid. He wants us to throw parties and have people over, which we do, of course, but who ends up doing all the work? Me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's work that's totally unnecessary. You don't have to do anything. Nobody's forcing you to clean and buy a new outfit and think of some goddamn theme cocktail. We can just invite people over last minute and drink whatever we have and hang out. It's more fun that way, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they continue their argument, Matt is struck by the pettiness of everyday life. He at once pities it, is impatient with it, and longs for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? We can talk about it later. Matt didn't come over to hear us squabble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, Matt. Is Elizabeth -- is there any news?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact there is. I'll tell you in a moment. Who is he? (off their silence) Does she love him? Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to put you in this position. But I'm not really the one who put you there, am I? I just want to know who this guy is that my wife has been... seeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Matt, you're angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could be a therapist.    Very keen powers of observation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. I think we should talk another time. I think you need to cool it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt sits.    He's not leaving.    No one speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it Troy? That fucking Neanderthal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, don't you even, Mark.    Shame on you. You're her friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Matt's friend too. And this is a very unique and dramatic situation. I'd want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't betray her when she can't even defend herself. Matt, you may not be able to hear this right now, but it's not her fault. Women have needs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you fucking kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft    4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: KAI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your marriage was not... You worked so hard to make partner, and no one can take that away from you. But then you made partner, and you only got busier. And it's not like you were so involved with the girls. She was lonely. MATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're going to talk to me in clichs about women? Nothing is ever a woman's fault. Was it still going on when she had the accident? Kai looks away.    Mark nods. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I stayed out of it, Matt. Anytime Kai talked about it, I walked away. MATT (to Kai)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you what? You probably egged her on. Add some drama to your life without any actual risk. Whom do you think you're protecting anyway? She doesn't need your protection -- it's over. She's going to die. KAI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that. MATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I almost told you yesterday. She's never going to wake up. It's for sure now. You hear me? We're pulling the plug. You were putting lipstick on a corpse. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Matt.    That's a little intense. Kai's face dissolves into tears. Mark reaches out to comf her. Everybody falls back to Earth. MATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I didn't mean to take it out on you guys. I just... Does she love him? Matt looks at him blankly, then at Kai.      He'd like to too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you ask about him when she's going to die? Who cares? Yes, she loves him, loved him, whatever. She's crazy about him. She was going to ask you for a divorce. Matt is stunned but oddly relieved.       The truth, once revealed, blows a calming wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still haven't told me who he is.        I guess it doesn't matter. Matt rises to his feet and leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as Matt reaches the sidewalk, Mark comes loping out the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian Speer. His name is Brian Speer. Two e's. A PET GOAT tied up in the front yard watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a discreet distance, we notice that Matt has stopped walking to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wandering up the driveway, Matt finds Alexandra sitting w Scottie and SOME GUY. Scottie now wears an oversized t-sh reading, "She's fat. I'm drunk. It's on." They stop laughing when they see Matt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, this is Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sizing him up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Sid. Lanky and odd, a permanent smirk on his face, SID rises f his lounge chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants          PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Dr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Sup, bro?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they shake hands, Sid pulls Matt into a man-hug and th him on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ever do that to me again. (to Alexandra) Get ready, okay? We're going to Grandma and Grandpa's. (to Scottie) Auntie Esther will come over to watch you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid's coming with us, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid, this week, what's going on, is a real family matter. You understand. (to Alexandra) Sid's not going to be interested in meeting your grandparents. He'll be bored stiff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I told you he was going to be with me. I'll be a lot more civil with him around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (arms wide, shrugging) What can I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt approaches the car with Alexandra and the interloper

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he know what we're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, your wife is dying and then you find out she's been stepping out on you? That's harsh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants     PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt watches retired military man SCOTT THORSON (70s) mum as he sits at a table glancing over DOCUMENTS. Sid is splayed out on a nearby lounge chair. Alex seated his feet. Every so often a PET PARROT squawks loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is like reading Korean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott, I'll be happy to walk you through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tossing the papers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jibber-jabber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an advanced directive -- basically her instructions on what medical procedures she wants or, in this case, does not want. No prolonged mechanical ventilation, no --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know goddamn well what it says. Says she doesn't want everyone waiting around while she spoils like milk. Says if the doctors can't do squat, she'd just as soon get on with it. He stares off into space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gramps, are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth had the good sense to write this thing here. Always a thoughtful girl. A strong girl. A hell of a lot stronger than her brother. Barry whines his way through life. Might even be a homosexual, for all I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Scott, I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants         PINK Shooting Draft    4/11/10 Dr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she's stronger than you, Matt. She lived more in a year than you did in a decade, sitting in your office, hoarding all your cash. All that money you refuse to use -- what the hell good is it? And now you and your family are cashing in your chips -- what the hell for? Maybe if you'd let my baby have her own boat and bought her some safe equipment or let her go on those shopping sprees women like, maybe she wouldn't have gone in for those thrill sports. Maybe if you'd provided more thrills at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you, Alexandra. Putting your poor mother through hell when all she was trying to do was instill some sense and drive in you. Shame on you. You should try to be more like her. She's a good girl. She's a good girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old man climbs to his feet and takes a few steps away Hands on hips, he looks up as though gauging the weather. Then he clears his throat, wipes his face with his sleeve turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all want a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he wanders away toward the kitchen --

dialogues.speaker: LATER --
dialogues.text: Scott returns pushing a little DRINK-CART. Behind him tra his wife ALICE. An Alzheimer's victim, Alice is a sweet woman, alert but unable to grasp or recall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, do we have guests?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kissing her) Hi, Alice. Good to see you.       It's me, Matt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants     PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ALEXANDRA (hugging her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Tutu. SCOTT THORSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Alexandra. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. SCOTT THORSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's your granddaughter. And this is your son-in-law Matt. This is your family. Well, except this kid. I don't know who the hell he is. (to Sid)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? Why are you here? ALEXANDRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my friend. SID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon. SCOTT THORSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, we're going to go to Queen's Hospital today and see Elizabeth. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are? Queen Elizabeth? That's wonderful. I've never met a queen before. I have to put on a nice dress. Sid bursts out LAUGHING. SID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she serious? SCOTT THORSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You be quiet, son. (then --)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Alice. Our Elizabeth. Our baby. We need to go visit her in the hospital. She needs us, just like when she was a little girl. Let's think about what she might want in her room. We'll take it to her and put it next to her bed. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's a queen. I have to look good for a queen. Don't you want me to look good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft      4/11/10 D

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sid LAUGHS again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Alice. (then --)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, old gal. You go ahead and say whatever you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never met a queen before. When Sid snickers again, Scott Thorson approaches him and glares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, man. I was just laughing. It's funny. I think she knows she's being funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to hit you. Scott POPS HIS FIST into Sid's face.           Sid FLIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car in motion, Matt glances in the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the eye? In the backseat, Sid holds a package of FROZEN PEAS to hi puffy blue eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was unreal. I mean, how often do old people just haul off and fucking cold-cock you in the face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's hit me a couple times over the years. And watch your language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, let me kiss it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, could you two just cool it around me? You know, stop... touching each other so much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Maybe that's why your wife cheated on you, if you're so against touching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAMMING ON THE BRAKES, Matt turns around, points a menac finger. Even Alexandra realizes Sid went too far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You little fuck.   Do you get hit a lot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.    I've had my share.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Alex) Your friend is completely retarded. You know that, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, my little brother's retarded. Don't use that word in a derogatory fashion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt looks at him. Given who Sid is, there's no reason to think he wouldn't have a retarded brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Psych! I don't have a retarded brother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You suck, Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of retarded, do you ever feel bad for wishing a retarded person or an old person would just hurry up? Sometimes I wait for them to cross the street, and I'm like, come on already! But then I feel bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rather than lashing out again at Sid, Matt turns around a lowers his head into one hand, squeezing his temples. It' all getting to be too much for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (noticing his anguish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget -- I know where he lives. Matt thinks a moment, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt's car passes by the well-known crowded surf-point overlook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been doing any surfing over there on the Big Island?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't surfed in years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, how come? You were so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first I stopped because I got my period and didn't know how to use a tampon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't want to attract sharks, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I wouldn't go for, you know, five days or so, and then I guess I just stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you ask Mom to show you or teach you or whatever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car continues on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't even tell her I got my period for like a year. She was always pushing me to look older and act older, so I just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even I know how to use a tampon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first time I got my period I thought I shit my pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ew, maybe you did!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid, shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure he knows what's going on with our family? Because he sure doesn't act like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car creeps down a street of lovely homes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know anything about him? Like what he does or if he's married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just his name.   Brian Speer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you ask Kai and Mark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want to get into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll google him later.    Okay, there it is. Stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt pulls over opposite a supremely average-looking hous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants         PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Dra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There?   He lives there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I can't say for sure he lives there. That's just where I saw them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you just happened to be driving by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadie was driving. We both saw it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all observe closely, very focused.        Nothing ha It's just a house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That house is a piece of shit. At least go after a guy who's got a mansion. And do you think he's married? That'd be pretty cold-blooded to do it in a house where you're married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid, please be quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'm just showing you the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all think a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I go ring the bell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tempted, then --) No, wait, this is stupid -- this stalking, or whatever the hell we're doing. We came, we saw. Whatever. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not like we're stalking him exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A PLUMBING TRUCK drives up the road. The three of them reflexively crouch down before catching themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you do if you saw him, anyway? Talk to him or punch him or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I just want to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I know is, someone messed with my girl, all hell would break loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever, Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, you'd never do that to me, would you? You know, if we ever got married. Fuck around on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends on how you treated me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're not getting married.       Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting the car)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, that's enough. We're getting out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt's just about to turn back onto Kahala Avenue when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft    4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go back a couple of houses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt does so, checking that the coast is clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There who is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt and Sid look toward a HOUSE FOR SALE. At first they don't get it, but soon their gaze drifts to the --

dialogues.speaker: "FOR SALE" SIGN
dialogues.text: complete with a PHOTO of the broker, none other than -- BRIAN SPEER -- his big white SMILE contrasting starkly wi haggard, unshaven Matt's SCOWL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we know what he looks like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be pretty handy for a dude having an affair to have some empty houses at his fingertips. (as Matt and Alex look at him) I'm just saying. That's how I'd do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexandra climbs out of the car to grab a FLYER and take photo of Brian Speer with her phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Images of Honolulu at DUSK TURNING INTO NIGHT -- STREETLI turning on across an entire neighborhood, boisterous pau- DRINKERS AT A BAR, a bus releasing weary commuters, an overhead shot of the environs of the KING HOUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trusted you. But there was always something about you I didn't trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of an internal PHONE RING begins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sitting area off the bedroom is where Elizabeth display her trophies and sports memorabilia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants          PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Dr

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: This is where Matt now sits nursing a whiskey and pressin PHONE to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, this is Brian Speer at Kaimana- Prudential Realty. Sorry I missed you. Leave a message with your name, number and time of call, and I'll get back to you just as soon as I can. Mahalo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking as though he's about to vomit, Matt hangs up, reg the flyer on the coffee table before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt looks up to see Sid in his boxers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you call him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
