dialogues.text: None of your business. And put some clothes on. And you're not sleeping in Alex's room. In fact, you should really go home, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex wouldn't like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guest room. Take it or leave it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to do what we're going to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to make it easy for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just fooling with you, man. We're not like that. Guest room's awesome. (then --) Just call him. He's nobody. Raise hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt sits on the bed, listening once again to Brian Speer outgoing message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the BEEP) Yeah, hi, Brian. My name's, uh, Herb Fitzmorris. I'm interested in that house you've got on Koloa Street, the one with the plantation shutters. I'm at 645-2796. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Matt leads his daughters toward Elizabeth's room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go in for just a quick moment alone first. I'll be right out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt closes the glass door behind him and slides the priv curtain across it. He looks at his wife. She's starting t look different -- her face more gaunt, her hair more matt Since the last time we saw her, OTHER ITEMS have been add around her bed. Along with draped LEIS, we see a childhoo DOLL, DIPLOMAS, and of course SPORTS MEDALS and RIBBONS. antique QUILT covers her legs. Her father meant it when h said they'd bring her old things. Matt crouches down bedside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were going to ask me for a divorce? So you could be with some fucking fuckhead Brian Speer? Are you kidding me? Who are you? Because the only thing I know for sure is that you're a goddamned liar. So what do you have to say for yourself? Go ahead, make a little joke and tell me I've got it all wrong. Tell me again I'm too out of touch with my feelings and need to go to therapy. (then --)                                               * Isn't the idea of marriage to make your partner's way in life a little easier? For me it was always harder with you. And you're still making it harder. Lying there on a ventilator and still fucking up my life. You're relentless. You know what? I was going to ask you for a divorce some day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants         PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Dra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing a DOLL, tossing it) Daddy's little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt rises, looks at her motionless face, exhales, gets himself together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm bringing in your daughters now. Alex is home from school. Try to be nice, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slides the curtain open and lets the girls in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mom!   Look who's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexandra approaches the bed slowly, startled by the chan in her mother's appearance and knowing the end is near.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say something, Alex. People in a coma can hear you. You're supposed to talk to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her how you were drunk the other night. Tell her maybe you're an alcoholic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it's in the genes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls, be serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mom. Sorry for being bad. For wasting your money on expensive private schools. Money you could have used on facials and massages and sports equipment. Sorry for everything. (looking at Matt) Sorry we weren't good enough for you -- especially Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it.   That's out of line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ALEXANDRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or what? You going to ground me? Or ship me off to another boarding school? You going to give me a "time out?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit! Unable, in front of Scottie, to remind Alex that Elizabet dying, Matt grabs his older daughter and SPANKS her. SCOTTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got served! MATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie, out in the hall. SCOTTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's the one out of line. MATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go find Sid. SCOTTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's smoking. I shouldn't be around second-hand smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now! As Scottie runs outside -- ALEXANDRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you just spank me? MATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no right to talk to your mother that way. She's going to die in a few days. What if those were your last words?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have every right to speak this way. I'm mad at her. How can you be so forgiving? Matt considers this. Of course she didn't see his recent outburst, and he's not about to let on. MATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be angry later. For now let's just think about the good parts. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MATT (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't say that stuff in front of your sister. Don't ruin her for Scottie. Say something else. ALEXANDRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Mom, I know we fought a lot. But I always wanted to be like you. I am like you. I'm exactly like you. God, that came out so dramatic. MATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are like her. Mostly in good ways. Maybe some bad ways. Remains to be seen. Sid saunters inside with Scottie in tow. SID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you got spanked. I hear all hell's breaking loose in here. (approaching the bed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mrs. K., howzit? I'm Sid, Alex's friend from Punahou, remember? Nice day outside. No clouds. Not too hot. You know what I think? Tough lady like you? I think you're going to make it. I mean, I'm no doctor. What do I know? But that's what I think. Matt squints at Sid.   Is he stoned? SID (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm staying at your place to help Alex out. Don't worry, Mr. K.'s got me on lockdown at night. And I met your dad - - he packs a mean punch. Look at this. (bringing his face closer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. You're beautiful. (to Alexandra)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you look anything like her when you're older, you're lucky. I mean, you know, not exactly like she is now. I mean in general. Sid turns back for a long look at Elizabeth. SCOTTIE (looking at her phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reina just texted me! She's here visiting her grandma! Can she come visit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft    4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit, Scottie, no Reina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you said Thursday, and it's almost Thursday. I don't get to see her in school anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need her. Alex needs Sid.       I need Reina. Matt looks at Alex, who in turn raises her eyebrows -- wh harm could it do?

dialogues.speaker: LATER --
dialogues.text: Scottie pushes open the door, now accompanied by her frie REINA, 12, who looks around as if the room is dirty. She wears a terry-cloth tennis skirt and hooded terry-cloth sweatshirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, this is Reina. Reina, that's my sister and Sid, and that's my mom on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, everybody. Alex and Matt look at each other, bewildered. Scottie lea Reina to the bed and touches her mother's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is your mother? I guess it's true. Should I shake her hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Reina, I hear your grandmother's not feeling well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants     PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: REINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's pretty bad. She got her stomach operated on and then got some stupid infection or something. It's pretty gross. MATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Reina, thanks for stopping by, and, here, Scottie, let me give you some money, and you two can go get an ice cream or something... REINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too many carbs. MATT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carbs. Well, you could go to the cafeteria and get some lettuce. REINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. I'm done. (to Scottie, on her way out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You aren't a liar after all. SCOTTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want to hang out? REINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I should go. I'll see you at the club. Hope your mom gets better. Exit Reina. ALEXANDRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie, what'd she mean by "You aren't a liar after all?" What'd she think you were lying about? SCOTTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't believe Mom was sleeping. ALEXANDRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you had to prove to that twat that Mom's in a coma? What the fuck is in your skull, a bunch of stupid pills? SCOTTIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, you motherless whore! SID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, easy there, half-pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants         PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Dra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you learn how to talk like that? Scottie points at Alex. Matt's PHONE RINGS. He pulls it out to silence it but notices the CALLER ID -- KAIMANA-PRUDENTIAL REAL ESTATE. He freezes. Sensing something, Alex calmly grabs the phon from him and glances at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? No, you've got the right number. This is his assistant Sharon. How may I help you? Alex listens.       Scottie has no idea what's going on, sure is fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I see. And for how long? Uh-huh. Okay. So one or the other. I'll tell him. Mahalo. Alexandra hangs up, proud.         Matt's proud too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was Bonnie Tanaka, a realtor. She says Mr. Speer is on Kaua'i till the 18th, but she'd be happy to show you the house or you can stop by the open house on Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MANY CARS are parked outside.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. KING HOUSE
dialogues.text: PLATTERS of sashimi, fruit, ahi poke and salads lie atop antique koa dining room table. LONGTIME FRIENDS, 40s to 70s, mingle in the living room a around the pool. We spot Mark and Kai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants      PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt is spacing out alone, perhaps mentally rehearsing hi speech. Awkward teen BUZZ happens by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mr. King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about Mrs. King.    Hope she gets better real soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It really blows. Matt nods, swigs his drink. Buzz now feels emboldened to reveal the cocktail concealed behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't tell my mom I'm drinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I steal beers from your outdoor fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Buzz slinks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've all been asking about Elizabeth, and I've given vague answers. But the reason I've asked you all to come over today is to tell you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt addresses the gathering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...that her coma is permanent.     She's not going to make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This week -- tomorrow, in fact -- as per her wishes, we're going to unhook her from life-support. (holding for gasps) You all know Elizabeth -- she always likes to do things on her own. Goddammit. (almost losing it) I wanted to tell you all in person. You're all our dear friends, our best friends. And the girls and I appreciate so much all the ways you've helped these last few weeks -- bringing food, calling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we see her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, for God's sake, yes. That's the whole point. Go see her as soon as possible. That's what I wanted to tell you. It should be now, not after. Everyone who loves her deserves a chance to say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt waves goodbye to the last guests as they drive off, turns back toward his house. Halfway there, his exhaustio forces him to COLLAPSE onto the moist lawn. Sitting there, he comes to a REALIZATION -- not one he wa but he knows he must deal with it regardless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've lost your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt is catching up on WORK and has a DICTAPHONE in his h Alex hovers in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean him? Tell him to say goodbye?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll only be gone a day or so. I'll leave in the morning, and be back tomorrow night. If it takes another day, fine -- I'll give it two days tops. If I don't find him, at least I tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants          PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Dr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop it, Dad. You've got way bigger fish to fry than confronting fucking Brian Speer. Are you recording this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm summarizing a deposition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you go to a movie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get Scottie out of the house. And you're going to tell him to come back and see Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think... I just think she would want him to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just call his office and say it's an emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the phone he can escape. In person he has nowhere to go. I want to see his face. I want to change his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander senses his resolve -- it's kind of refreshing, actually -- then breaks into a wicked little smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I want to go too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you stay with Scottie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck that.     Let's all get out of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Hawaiian Airlines inter-island airplane takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt sits isolated from his daughters and Sid across the aisle from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants     PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: MAP OF THE ISLANDS
dialogues.text: A DOTTED LINE goes from Honolulu to Lihue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt leads his daughters and Sid toward the rental car shuttle when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Matt King! Matt turns to see COUSIN RALPH loping over, briefcase in hand. Like Matt, he wears the island businessman's unifor Khakis and a Reyn's Spooner shirt. Grinning and nodding, Cousin Ralph gives Matt a back-slap and greets Scottie and Alexandra, whose names he clearly forgets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatcha doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just came over for a day or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I just got back from Kahului.    A little business over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. So you here to talk to some of the cousins? Make sure everybody's happy with your choice? Pay your respects to Cousin Hugh? Matt's smiles to cover the fact that he hasn't actually b thinking about this stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, nothing like that. Just a little holoholo. Get the kids out of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it is Holitzer, right? We all know it's Holitzer. Cousin Hugh wants him, they go way back. I got my misgivings, though. It's not the highest bid by a longshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants         PINK Shooting Draft    4/11/10 Dr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an argument to be made for maxing it out. We only do this once in a lifetime. And in this economy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, no, I know. I want to work with you guys, Ralph, I really do. Whatever the majority wants, I'll go along with it. Let's just get it over with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Elizabeth doing?     She going to be okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she's a tough gal. She'll be okay. Yeah. Say, where you going, Hanalei?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Princeville.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.    I'll give you a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an open jeep with bad shocks, and Cousin Ralph drive fast. The passengers hold on, their hair blown back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn off over here.     Let's go see the land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a last look, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got nothing but time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants     PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cousin Ralph makes a turn and heads inland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jeep stops at a FENCE, where a HERD OF CATTLE graze o the other side. Matt jumps out to let the jeep through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think this is where a golf course is going to be. They want the golf course to rival Pebble Beach, you know, bring in the big boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jeep ascends through pastoral countryside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jeep stops at the overlook of an astonishingly beauti swath of land extending from hilltop to bay. All get out, walk to the edge, look out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you shitting me?   You guys own all this land?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not personally. It belongs to a trust. But yeah, it's ours for a few more days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other side of that ridge too. You can't see it from here. It's like this, but a little flatter and doesn't have as nice a bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is outrageous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing, to Matt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Big resort there on that point. Commercial area over there, houses all through there. I think they should put in a big zip-line. Hell, we should have put in a zip-line. All continue to ogle this awe-inspiring sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft      4/11/10 D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, part of me agrees with the cousins who don't want to sell. They're going to make a pretty big stink at the meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but we have to sell. The trust has to dissolve in seven years, and if we haven't sold, it'll be a huge mess. Selling now and distributing the cash is the only clean way to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's a shame, yeah? On the other hand, hey, it's just sitting there. No one's using it. At least this way the whole world will be able to enjoy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his daughters) Take a good look, girls. In the old days, this was part of your great-great grandmother's inheritance going all the way back to Kamehameha I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With them, we look across this land, vivid and verdant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down there is where Mom and I would camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all did, all our lives.       A lot of memories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about me? I want to camp.        I wish we lived in the old days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do. We still do. (to Matt) Do we really have to sell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doing anything else would get extremely complicated. A lot of your cousins just want the money. Everything has its time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want us to keep it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Matt looks over at Scottie, then at Alexandra.        It' that Alexandra is moved by this sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you like specify what businesses they'll put here? Because you should totally get a Cheesecake Factory. Only one so far's in Waikiki, and it's awesome. You definitely need a Cheesecake Factory. And Taco John's.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER --
dialogues.text: The Kings approach a nearby MONUMENT commemorating "John Lowell "Keoni" King. 1899 - 1974. The plaque depicts a smiling man atop a horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the girls)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My grandfather. He really loved this place. So did your mother. So does your mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cousin Ralph turns off the Kuhio Highway and into PRINCEVILLE, which greets visitors with an immense faux- Italian FOUNTAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing through this immense development, Matt notices th names of the condo complexes: The Sand Piper, The Island Tropic, etc. And he observes TOURISTS along the edge of the golf cours with their visors and fanny packs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph drops our friends off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Sid slump against a marble pillar. Scottie has taken her shoes off to slide across the shiny floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your credit card back, Mr. King. And how many keycards will you be needing today for your deluxe suite?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's say three. By the way. I'm supposed to meet a buddy of mine I think is staying here. Brian Speer.       S- P-E-E-R.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking computer) I'm not showing anyone by that name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving in.

dialogues.speaker: LATER --
dialogues.text: Matt is on the telephone, nodding gravely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I understand.   Okay.    Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt hangs up, blinks a few times, spaces out a moment. he slides open the glass door to the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- where he finds Alexandra smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put that out, will you please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex shoots him a look, then stamps out the butt on the bottom of her shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could at least smoke lights.       Like Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just got off the phone with Dr. Johnston. They did what they had to do a couple hours ago. They've moved her to another floor. They say she seems comfortable, still breathing on her own. She's doing okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Alexandra nods at this news and looks off.       Matt joi gazing out at Hanalei Bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how are you doing, Alex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? You mean considering Mom's... circling the drain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean other than that. In general. You haven't been using, have you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Jesus, I'm not using.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all? I smell pot all the time on Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you just stopped?   Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Dad, it's no big deal. Kids do drugs and they stop. Unless they're like super-ghetto. And you sent me to boarding school, remember? I couldn't get anything anymore. So no, I'm not doing any drugs. But I still think they're fun. Okay, maybe a little pot once in a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a little drinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't deny that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you being so honest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom's dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I'm proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants     PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much to be proud of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, there is. We shipped you off. Let them handle it. And now you're here, helping with Scottie, helping me. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to know what really pisses me off? That she wouldn't end it. Not even when she knew she was busted. How are we supposed to feel about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess she really liked him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how are we going to find this guy, Sherlock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Well, why don't you two take Scottie to the beach? I'm going to call around a little. We're on an island, for Christ's sake. Everything's just one degree of separation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt scans the BEACH as he ambles toward Sid and his daughters lying on towels. Scottie is snuggled close to S Matt notices LUMPS OF SAND stuffed into Scottie's bikini

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what's in your suit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're my beach boobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take that out. Right now. Alex, Jesus, why'd you let her do that?    You too, Sid. Lying on her stomach, Alex lifts her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants         PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Dra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Take them out, stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Scottie. Honestly.       Big boobs look kind of fatty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scowling, Scottie gets up and starts pulling the sand out her suit as she stomps toward the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any luck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hotels were a dead end, but I took another shot with his office. He's definitely in Hanalei renting a house somewhere -- probably one of those cottages around the bay. Who wants to go for a walk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt grimaces -- not whom he was hoping for.         Alex straps of her bikini and flips over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, let's go. Scottie!

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER --
dialogues.text: Our friends weave their way among BEACH-GOERS. Matt has thought to bring along a print-out of Brian Speer's PHOTO which he and Alex glance at discreetly. Sid trails behind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (catching up to Matt) Can we swim with the sharks? I read in the hotel magazine how they put you in a cage in the ocean and throw shark feed in the water and sharks swim right up to you. Can we do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie, we're not really here to do stuff like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun approaches the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Father, daughters and Sid have walked past people and hou Now they're walking just to be walking. We see them from distance, although we hear them very close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you and Mom meet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was with a law school buddy from the mainland, and I took him to the club. We were just coming in from paddling, and your mom was on her way out, and she looked at me and said, "Do you think it's going to snow today?" We all got beers when she came back in. I had already seen her around. That was it. I got her number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you think she was pretty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knocked me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you love about her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love... I don't know. The way we are with each other, most of the time, anyway. I love how she's more capable of feeling joy than anyone I've ever known. I just like being with her, just riding bikes or going out to dinner, even if it's just a plate lunch at Rainbow's. Years ago we used to do a lot of paddling together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we drop this? Jesus. (mimicking) "What do you love about Mom, Daddy?" Shut up, already. (to Matt) And stop babying her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, Alex. We're just talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our friends continue walking, this time amid THICK TREES along the shoreline. Again we see them from afar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mom got chased by a shark once. Very close call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were on Moloka'i with Mark and Kai, and your mom was out surfing and saw a shark right beneath her on a wave. Like right beneath her. She got down on her stomach and started paddling like crazy, and this big fin kept following her. She even paddled up onto the nearest rocks instead of all the way to shore. Got cuts all over her legs and hands. Only time I ever saw your mother scared, and she was really scared. She even threw up. Crying and shaking. I had to hold her for a long time.   She really thought she was going to die. Of course she hid all that from the Mitchells, turned it into a funny "Me-versus-a-shark" story. I told her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told her it wasn't her time yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue in silence a few moments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish Mom was here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is now very low on the horizon as our friends mak their way back to the hotel. Again we see them from a distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll ask you that same question, Scottie. What do you love about Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of stuff. She's not old and ugly like other moms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft     4/11/10 Dra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like her stories -- like how she streaked at the wedding and the time she beat a wild pig with a shoe. How about you, Alex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are we still talking about this? (then --) I like how she's not afraid of anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four are splayed out watching TV amid the messy remai of ROOM SERVICE DINNER. Alexandra and Scottie wield the REMOTE and stumble upon t channels promoting direct-access ADULT MOVIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's watch one of these!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not watching porn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reina's dad watches pornos. Reina calls them masturbation movies. Her dad has some. She plays them when her parents aren't home and one time invited boys over to see if they grew down there. One did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reina's awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you there?    Have you seen any of those movies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to watch her with     the internet. And Reina's dad.       Scottie, Reina is a fucked-up ho-bag,     and you need to stay away from her.      Do you want to end up like me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean the earlier me, when I was mean to you and yelling at mom all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Reina's going to be a meth-head, and she's going to get used by stupid guys. She's a twat. Say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a twat. (running across the room) Twat, twat, twat, twat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop that! (to Alexandra) I don't get it. I don't know what to do... these things she does. What goes on in her head? You weren't like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not so sure. I mean, look how you kids talk in front of me. It's like you don't respect authority.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex looks at him -- authority?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt tosses and turns, gets up and goes to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER --
dialogues.text: Exiting the bathroom, he decides he should make a routine inspection and wanders into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- where he eyes a lump on the FOLD-OUT BED.       He cre when Sid awakens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checking on me or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sheepish look on his face, Matt takes a seat on the edg the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't, uh... I haven't been sleeping very much lately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understandable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm worried about my daughters. I'm worried there's something wrong with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to do some messed-up shit when I was a kid. Still do. It's going to get worse after your wife dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does Alex really think about this stuff that's going on? What does she say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? I thought she talks to you all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't really talk about our like "issues." We just, I don't know, we deal with our shit by talking about other stuff and having a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you do if you were me? How would you handle my daughters? How would you handle... the situation of this guy we're trying to find?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt can't believe what he just asked, but he's desperate clues from even the unlikeliest source.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants     PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you what I'd do -- I'd lay his nuts on a dresser and hit `em with a spiked bat. With the daughters, I don't know. I'd take them on a trip. Or no, I'd buy `em a bunch of shit. Like with all the money you're going to get when you sell the land -- you're going to make stupid money, right? -- dude, you could buy them anything. Matt questions his sanity at having asked Sid any advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want some of it?   Some money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I gave you a lot of money right now, tonight, would you leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Sid, I'm asking you a favor.    If I give you money, will you leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I get it. Is that what you want? You want me to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, dude, you're right. If I had daughters, I wouldn't know what to do. Exchange them for sons, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I might wind up with something like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not so bad.   I'm smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're about a hundred miles away from Smartville. No offense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants     PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're mistaken, counselor. I'm smart. I have good hygiene. I'm an decent guitarist, a good cook. I cook food all the time. I'm vice-president of the Punahou chess club. And I always have weed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure your parents are proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's possible.    My mom's sort of busy right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does she do, your mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a receptionist at a pet clinic. But mostly she's been getting the house together after my dad died. My dad died a few months ago. At first refusing to fall for it, Matt sees this is no pr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: November 24th. Drunk driver. Actually both drivers were drunk. Yeah. Sid smiles and nods as though to make Matt feel better ab the sad news he just shared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Sid.    I'll see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUNRISE. Matt JOGS along the nearly empty beach -- just a few surf FISHERMAN and PADDLERS. He's clearly out of shap but makes a good effort. ANOTHER GUY jogs toward Matt wearing a "Stanford Lacrosse shirt and running shorts with long slits up the sides.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN SPEER
dialogues.text: They pass each other. Matt continues on a moment in disbelief, then TURNS AROUND and follows. His strides lon and efficient, Brian gives Matt a run for his money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants         PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Dra

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Soon Brian cuts up the beach toward one of the COTTAGES t line the bay. Matt follows, awkwardly trying to appear nonchalant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Hi, you don't know me, but I know you. Hi, you don't know me, but I know you. Brian Speer, right? Hi, I'm Liz's husband. That's right. Fuckface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian disappears up a little PATH through a HEDGE. quickens his pace toward --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- where he spies on Brian walking across a wide lawn tow a lovely OLD COTTAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.    You don't know me, but I know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian disappears inside, emerging moments later chugging GATORADE. Courage gathered, Matt is about to charge forward when he stops short -- the door opens again, and out comes a beautiful WOMAN in a white bathing suit and white sun hat Then two LITTLE BOYS. Fucker's got a family.      Not the right moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is higher, and the BEACH is growing populated. Matt sits on the sand, glancing occasionally back toward cottage. Next to him lie his daughters and Sid. Suddenly TWO BOYS -- Brian's kids -- come running through hedge and past Matt on their way into the water. Matt turns around to see Brian's wife JULIE SPEER dutiful trailing behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay in the zone, please! That means you, Skylar. And you too, Colt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low) Skylar and Colt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Matt watches the little boys flop into the surf.        M follows, wading in up to her calves. Matt stands to look whether Brian is coming down to the b too. No such luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Alex) I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt gets to his feet, brushes off sand, and walks casual toward Mrs. Speer, maintaining a comfortable distance. Alexandra watches.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SURF --
dialogues.text: Matt takes up a casual stance near Mrs. Speer and pretend look out at the water, just hanging out. Mrs. Speer continues to keep a watchful eye on her boisterous boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you got yourself a handful with those two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must keep you pretty busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're pretty non-stop, but they're at a really fun age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight and ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) I have two girls. Ten and seventeen. That whole non-stop thing. That never changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys live here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We live on O'ahu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so do we.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm just getting my girls out of town for a couple days. Their, uh, their mother is in the hospital, so I thought I'd give them a little break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? If you don't mind my asking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a little boating accident.       Hit her head a little too hard. Does Julie recognize any of this, or even recognize him? Doesn't seem like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sailboat? Or one with a motor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs, then --)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One with a motor. She's actually sort of charming, this Julie Speer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, good luck with that. I wish her well. Skylar, don't go so far!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys staying in one of the cottages over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, my husband had to come here for work, so we thought we'd all make a little vacation of it. He knows the owner, so --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugh King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my cousin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Then you probably know my husband. Brian Speer? That hangs there a moment.      Matt suppresses the sudde to spill the beans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, can't say as I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I just assumed, since he's been --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!     Dad, come here!   Something bit me! Matt looks over to see Scottie very agitated about someth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.     Nice talking to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too.    Take care. Matt trots off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Images of Hanalei as the sun begins to set over the magnificent taro fields. Wind rustles the trees. Mist fal into the valley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I forgive her for loving someone else? Did she even know about his family? Was she that in love? Does she miss him from her coma? Does she wish he could be with her and not me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our friends walk along roadside tourist shops toward --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lived-in hangout with a wood interior, woven mats on th walls, and tables carved into with steak knives. A UKULEL CLUB jams in a corner. As our foursome enter the joint, Matt notices --

dialogues.speaker: COUSIN HUGH
dialogues.text: yucking it up at the BAR with other REGULARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Alexandra)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's Cousin Hugh.      Get us a table. Order me something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BAR --
dialogues.text: Matt wedges his way in beside his third cousin, who despi his booziness and very local flavor is nonetheless a King family patriarch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heeey! Mattie-boy! What are you doing here? I didn't expect to see you until the meeting. He looks over his shoulder to see whom Matt might have co in with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Scottie and Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big girls now! So what are you doing here, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just getting the girls out of the hospital for a couple days, you know, change of scenery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants         PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Dra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, boy, what you've been going through. That's a tough deal. (taking a drink) But Elizabeth, hey, she's, she's a tough gal, I'll tell you that. A fighter. She'll make it. Get you a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, what're you having?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barney, an old-fashioned for my cousin here. Nice to see you, Matt. How you been otherwise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much otherwise. Between our business and the hospital, you know, I've just trying to keep my head above water. So listen, I see you have some people staying in the cottage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, Mattie, if I'd known you were coming, I coulda --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no, I'm just wondering about the guy you're renting to. I think his name is Brian Speer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, real determined son-of-a- bitch. He's Lou's sister's... No, wait. Lou has a sister, and the sister's husband... Lou's brother-in- law is cousins with that guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?   Who's Lou?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, wait. You mean the cottages on the bay or the cottage back by the trail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bay.   The guy with the wife and two boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's right. Determined son-of- a-bitch. Anyway, the point is the guy we're doing business with is that guy's brother-in-law. Works for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian Speer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, the guy we're doing business with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you think? Don Holitzer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holitzer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm saying. That's Don's brother-in-law in the cottage. You don't know him? I would have thought you'd know him. He's a realtor over by you. So if we sell to Don -- and that's what we're going to do, right? That's what you want too. Nice guy, Don. He'll do right by us. Then when Don develops and re-sells and leases and all that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's letting this brother-in-law in the cottage handle the transactions. A lot of them, anyway. Big score for that guy. It takes a moment for this stone to drop to the bottom of Matt's well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants      PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian Speer -- what else do you know about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much. He's lucky. The bugga's lucky. His sister is married to the guy. Son-of-a-bitch is going to make a shitload of money on commissions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if we don't go with that bid. Cousin Hugh's eyes emerge momentarily from their drunken to give Matt a firm, steely warning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all want Don. You do too, Matt. You've said as much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I know. You're right. Okay. Well. Good to see you, Hugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you at the meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be there.

dialogues.speaker: TRACK TO THE TABLE
dialogues.text: firmly on MATT'S FACE as he processes this horrifying new delivered so casually.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TABLE --
dialogues.text: Matt takes a seat. Scottie and Sid eat fried appetizers. Alexandra just sits watching the musicians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ordered you mahi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. The music grows more frenetic. Matt looks around the room, alienated from everything -- the fried food and the tourists, from the umbrellas in th drinks, from his daughters enjoying the music and this cr called Sid. Why can't a nuclear bomb blow the whole island up right n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light is swiftly fading, and our heroes are little mo than SILHOUETTES as they walk back to the hotel. Sid and Scottie talk and laugh together.      Alex walks father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, guess what. Turns out Brian Speer is connected to Don Holitzer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Don Holitzer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy we're going to sell to. And that woman today at the beach. That was his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose wife? (then --)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hottie with the hat? You sure? (off his nod)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he's married. Nice. Why didn't you say anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's him I want to talk to, not her.       I know where their cottage is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do? So let's do it right now. Let's go knock on his door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm saying. Alexandra quietly exults.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants          PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Dr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do that. Don't be excited.        This isn't fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's what we came here to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you to talk to his wife while I talk to him. And figure out some way to distract Scottie and their kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.    Sid, come here!

dialogues.speaker: A109 MOMENTS LATER --
dialogues.text: The team are gathered for a little huddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Dad and I are going to go talk to some friends while Sid takes you back to the hotel, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to come too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't. Who wants to sit around talking in some house? Let's ditch these losers and go watch some serious TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they walk away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Matt, low) Give `em hell, boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zero hour. Matt and Alexandra approach the cottage from t road and start to walk around it toward the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.     What should I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants           PINK Shooting Draft      4/11/1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll think of something.          You're a lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry for sucking you into this.           I should be doing this alone. It's selfish of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the one who sucked you in.          I'm the one who knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as they are round the house toward the lanai, Julie Speer backs out of the screen door with a plate of hambur patties. Alex nudges Matt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be a pussy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stiffly) Hi there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen door slams.       Julie looks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the guy from the beach today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, hey, I'm such an idiot. I just figured out I do know your husband. My daughter and I were on our way back to the hotel from dinner, and we thought we'd drop by and say howdy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouthing) Howdy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.   Come on up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Matt King.       This is Alexandra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Julie Speer.      Yeah, I thought that was you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants     PINK Shooting Draft    4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been in the paper so much lately. I figured you had to know Brian. He's been pretty involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, no, I know, yeah, super-involved. Maybe I've met him in passing. I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I guess you guys are deciding really soon. A couple of days, right -- you and your family meet? I'm sorry. That's probably a conflict of interest or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's okay. You're right -- it'll all be over in a couple of days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys want a burger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just ate, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drink then. As Alex and Matt agree, a figure appears at the screen do BRIAN SPEER emerges, a bag of BUNS in one hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian, we may have met before. Matt King. My wife is Elizabeth King. I think you may have met her too. Our daughter Alexandra. Brian's big GRIN WILTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just going to get drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, good. Good. Matt nudges Alexandra, who suddenly remembers her duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over her shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, I got it. Alex is glad to keep her ringside seat for the moment. buckle their mental seatbelts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth is dying. Oh, wait. Fuck you. And she's dying. We unhooked her from the machines this morning. She'll be dead in a few days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not here to hurt you. We just thought she'd want you to know. As they've plotted, Alex and Matt study Brian's paralyzed face. They exchange a glance, then look back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is him? Why would she go for him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beats me.    Well, he's very articulate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't... I'm sorry. I never thought it would come to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sorry my mom's going to die? You're sorry you fucked her? You're sorry you fucked over my dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry for all of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, pal, like she said, I'm not here to wreck your life. I just came to give you a chance to go to the hospital. I don't know how long you're planning on being here, but I'm sure you can think of an excuse to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be good at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can be alone with her to say goodbye or whatever you want. Do you hear what I'm saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants      PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Brian seems deeply lost in his own thoughts.     Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, look, I can't have you here.     You understand. Julie returns with wine for Matt and a soda for Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go. (noticing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's so serious. Please don't tell me you're talking about business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're talking about love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice. Brian, call the boys in for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're fine. Let them play a while longer. They all stand there a moment. Matt's unsure how to play this out. He shoots a quick panicked look at Alex, who scrambles to keep the ball rolling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awesome cottage you're renting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, say, prime Hanalei location. I used to come here as a kid before it was a vacation rental. Alex, your great-uncle Warren and Aunt Lillian built it back in the 20s. Haven't been inside in years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.   We'll give you a tour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or, Brian, maybe you could give my dad a little walk down memory lane, and Julie and I can chat out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'd like that, if you don't mind. Just a quick look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft    4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.    But it's not like I live here. Matt walks up to the door, making a point to let Brian op it for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian sweeps his hand around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you meet?    I'm curious. For a moment Brian looks tricked, as if Matt really did j want a tour of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither can I.    How did you meet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said you came here just to tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I changed my mind. And I can't very well ask her the details. How'd you meet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Super Bowl party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (figuring it out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the Mitchells'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that help? Does that make it better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm doing you a favor here. I could go out there right now and fuck you up, so get a better attitude. Then what? How'd you get the nerve to ask her out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian drops his head, rubs his temples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know what makes a person cross that line. Was it about the deal? Is that when you decided she was for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. It's not what you think.     It just happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing just happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything just happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was she going to leave me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She would have. But I, I, uh... I didn't want that. That wouldn't have happened. I love Julie. (anguished) Please don't tell her. Please. I don't know what I've done. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she say she loved you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian nods slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you love her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't love her. You don't love her. You just used her to get to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I told you. I wasn't trying to get to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants     PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an affair, an attraction. Sex. And she got sort of... carried away with the whole thing, and I guess I went with it. I mean, I didn't exactly say no to things. I should have. I love my family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I guess it's all working out. Her lips are sealed, and you don't have to go through the trouble of dumping her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, that's really unfair. I had - - have -- a lot of respect for her. She's a wonderful woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad her husband found out. You can't win `em all. One more question. Have you ever been inside my bedroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tortured)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could have had the decency to lie about that one. Well, she's in Queen's Hospital if you want to say goodbye. That really is all I came to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't you be with her? Matt's face slackens into overwhelming sadness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt swings the screen door open. Alex sits with Julie. Skylar and Colt are still running around the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, great, all remodeled, new appliances. Nice. Alex, we should be getting back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hey, thanks for stopping by. Really nice to meet you both. Maybe we'll see you at the beach tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After Alex and Julie share a quick kiss goodbye -- a comm custom in Hawaii -- Julie turns to Matt. Matt leans in, but instead of going for her cheek, he kis her FULLY ON THE LIPS. He pulls away, and they exchange a brief, vaguely erotic look. Then he turns away and into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane is dark except for overhead READING LIGHTS. Aga Matt, Sid and the girls sit at the very BACK OF THE PLANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when do you think he'll show up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid leans forward from the middle seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was he sorry? I hope he was sorry, man. You could have told his wife, and you didn't. I hope he knows how lucky he is. I would have told her everything. She deserves to know. Or else she's going to be a dumb bitch the rest of her life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need to get creepy. Anyway, doesn't matter. That's all behind us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, the one we have to worry about telling things to now is Scottie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've asked Dr. Johnston to help us break the news tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They turn to look at little Scottie, dead to the world in window seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt and the kids walk slowly through this different, cal wing of the hospital looking for the right room-number. Finally they find it and push open the door into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While still a hospital room, there is no medical equipmen present. Bucolic colorful paintings on the wall are inten to be uplifting. But unlike the expansive view outside Elizabeth's ICU window, here the window looks out partial at a CINDER-BLOCK WALL. Sid and the Kings are greeted by DR. JOHNSTON and grief counselor DR. HERMAN, who affects a comforting smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, everyone. Matt. (off their greetings) This is Dr. Herman, whom I told you about. She works with us in counseling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (locking eyes with all) Hello, everyone. Hello. Hi.      Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two professionals allow the Kings to turn their atten to Elizabeth, who now lies with no machines at all. Aroun her BALLOONS droop, FLOWERS wilt, get-well CARDS lie in a pile. Elizabeth too is wilting and drooping. Her skin is pasty, and her cheeks are hollow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come Mom isn't on any more machines? Is she getting better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The adults exchange glances.     Dr. Herman approaches Sc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be Scottie. (off her nod --) Scottie, I have a present for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Herman hands her a little squeaky RUBBER OCTOPUS she pulls from her pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants           PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. It's an octopus. Such a funny creature with its eight legs. But did you know octopi are actually extremely intelligent, like dogs and cats? They have unique personalities, and just like us they have a lot of defense mechanisms. I'm sure you know about the ink sac. She uses ink to confuse her predators. She can camouflage herself. She can emit poison, and some can mimic more dangerous creatures, like the eel. I keep her to remind me of our defense mechanisms -- our ink, our camouflage, our poison, all the things we use to keep away hurt. The reason Dr. Johnston invited me here today is to meet you, Scottie. I've heard a lot about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard that you're a wonderful and unique and spirited girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Herman shoots a look at Matt before continuing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I've heard your mom's not doing too well and that she's going to die very soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All watch Scottie react to this news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, is that true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Scottie. It's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to have to be a very brave girl right now, and you're surrounded by people who love you. I came to meet you and tell you that if you ever want to talk about what you're feeling, I would like to talk to you too. I can help you face what's going on without all the silly defense mechanisms that work for an octopus but not for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.    Thank you, Dr. Herman. Dr. Herman looks at everyone with great sincerity before leaving. Scottie is left holding the octopus. She drops i and it squeaks a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, well, they say she's very good one- on-one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Mom's going to die for sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. We worked really hard with her, but three other doctors and I agree she's in what we call an irreversible coma. Do you know what that means?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means she doesn't have a brain anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly, but... yes, that's the general idea. So we're doing exactly what she wanted us to do if that ever happened. That's why she's not attached to the machines anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for the best, Scottie. Look at her. She's not happy like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The purpose of medicine is to heal, and we can't do that now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.     What will we do with her body? Dr. Johnston looks to Matt for this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First Mom's going to give some of her organs to other sick people, so she can help save their lives. That's a really neat thing she's doing. Then we're going to... we're going to scatter her ashes in the ocean. You know how Mom always loved the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her ashes? Scottie looks at her mother, picturing her as ashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When will she die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any day now, I'm afraid.       But you still have some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. Let me know if you have any more questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Sam. The doctor leaves, and the room is quiet.        Scottie sort of trance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, Scottie. Scottie goes to her sister, who takes her in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do eyeballs burn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Scottie.     Don't think about stuff like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt and the kids sit in a sort of vigil. Alex and Scotti read books, Matt has brought some paperwork, Sid reads a magazine. Elizabeth emits a SIGH.      All look up a moment before back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft    4/11/10 Dra

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Matt's PHONE VIBRATES.    Checking the caller ID -- HUGH he opts not to answer. The door opens, and Elizabeth's brother BARRY THORSON accompanies his parents Scott and Alice into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we are. (to Scottie) Hi, Bingo. Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheerful Alice doesn't really get what's going on. emotional Barry hugs Matt and the girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing Sid) There you are again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt and Alex maneuver seats for the Thorsons to sit near bed. Barry gets his mother situated, then takes a seat himself. Remaining on his feet, old Scott surveys his daughter fro distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what did you decide?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's not much left to decide. We're just sort of playing it by ear and making sure she's comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean what did you decide about the buyer? Who's your buyer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even Sid and his daughters perk up at this question. taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much are you getting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I'm sure you'll be able to read about it in the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need to read about it.     I can hear about it right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants     PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott, let's not talk about that here. It's not the time for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the same to you, I guess. A million here, a million there. Just ironic, that's all -- Elizabeth coming into this misfortune just as you're coming into a fortune. She gave you everything, Matt. A good, happy home, two beautiful daughters. Matt looks to Barry for help, but Barry's silence and sheepish look imply he buys into his father's propaganda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott, what's your point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wanted her own boat. She should have had her own boat, one she would have been familiar with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wasn't even driving! Her boat, someone else's boat -- it wouldn't have made any difference. You're not going to blame me for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, sure, quibble about the details. She was a faithful, devoted wife. She deserved more. Why fight it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. She deserved more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Christ's sake, take it easy on the man. Scott turns to Sid like he's about to pop him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father has been doing a really amazing job under the circumstances. His point made, Scott looks at Matt and the girls and shuffles to Elizabeth's bedside, puts his hands on Alice' shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we ready to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Mom.    Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing toward the door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls, Sid. Matt, Sid and the girls quietly go into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- where they take a few steps away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, that guy's a prick.       Was he always like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Scottie has stayed behind to peek through a crack in the door. Noticing, the others join her.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE DOOR --
dialogues.text: As Barry and Alice remain seated, their backs to us, Scot stands above his daughter, touching her arm, eyes closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he praying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opening his eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say goodbye to Elizabeth, Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.     Goodbye, Elizabeth. The old man puts his hand over his mouth and squeezes his eyes shut. Then he opens his eyes and places a hand on he forehead, smooths her hair back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt and his daughters watch without moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants      PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft
