dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt sits at his desk lost in thought. The only sound is tick-tock of an old clock reading 3:20. Then he gets up a starts pacing, shooting occasional glances at the BLUEPRI and RENDERINGS atop his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt turns off the highway and into a long driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt opens all front doors and lanai doors, letting air i the old place. He notices old PHOTOS OF KING ANCESTORS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt walks around the property alone, taking it in and thinking. Like everywhere in Hawai'i, the nature here is powerful -- TREES, BIRDS, SPIDERWEBS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt plops heavily into a chair on the lanai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the same angle but now with FORTY KING COUSINS gathe for the poll. We recognize some faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amid drinks held aloft, a CALABASH is passed among the cousins into which the each places a folded BALLOT. Matt sits watching the proceedings with Cousin Hugh, Cous Six and another ELDERLY COUSIN at a table piled with pape and contracts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth's not doing well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll be okay. She's a fighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She's dying.    We took her off the machines.

dialogues.speaker: LATER --
dialogues.text: Matt, Hugh and Six FINISH THE COUNT while others mill abo mingle, drink -- an early celebration for all except for group of DISSENTERS off to one side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no surprise. Other than the holdouts who don't want to sell at all, it's Don Holitzer. Chicago group a distant second. Feels good. We're doing the right thing, Mattie. At least there ain't going to be any Wal-Mart. Now it's your call, and we're all behind you, most of us anyway. (handing him a pen) Go ahead, Captain. Make it official.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's strange, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's strange?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't do anything to own that land. It was entrusted to us. And now we're just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugh and Six exchange a concerned look.      For a moment VERY CLOSE on Matt's eyes. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do it. I won't do it.     I'm not going to sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing, Matt? I mean, we know you have a lot on your plate right now, but you're not going to fuck this up for us. It's over. If we don't sell now, it'll be a mess when the trust dissolves. Just sign, go to your wife, done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants      PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's inevitable,   Matt. You know that. We'll get out of   debt -- the taxes and maintenance have   been leaching us for far too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants     PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want it to go to Holitzer. I don't want it to go to anyone. I want to keep it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Christ's sake. We can't move without your approval. And we don't want to. Hugh tries forcing Matt's hand.   Matt resists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your head's not right, Mattie. Your head's not right. You want a couple days to think it over? Take a couple days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need a couple days. I have the authority, and this is what I want. I haven't wanted something in a long time. We have other businesses we're converting to corporations. We can figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's utterly unproductive land. It doesn't generate enough income to pay the goddamn taxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the trustee. You know better than anyone we only have seven years left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I have seven years to figure out how to keep it. Cousin Hugh draws a long breath, looks up at the sky, the back at Matt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll come after you. Just because you're a lawyer doesn't mean the rest of us would be afraid to come after you. But nobody wants to do that. We're family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants      PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People will be relieved, Hugh, the whole state. I sign that document, it's over. End of the line. Something that was ours to protect will be gone. Even though we're haole as shit and go to private schools and clubs and can't even speak pidgin, let alone Hawaiian, we still carry Hawaiian blood, and we're still tied to this land. And our children are tied to this land. It's a miracle that for whatever bullshit reason 150 years ago, we own this much of... paradise, but we do. And for whatever bullshit reason now, I'm the trustee. And I'm not signing. And if you sue me, it'll only make us closer. Cousin Hugh releases a long breath more like a belch, qui picks his nose, exchanges a look with Cousin Six. Then he brings his fingers to his mouth to WHISTLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, everybody, listen up. Cousin Mattie has an announcement.     Get ready. Rising to his feet, Matt scans the faces of his relatives

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the way Matt, Sid and the girls are positioned aroun the room, we can tell their presence there is now way of life. Scottie snoozes on the little sofa. We may notice that Elizabeth is even more shrunken. A KNOCK is followed by --

dialogues.speaker: A VASE OF FLOWERS
dialogues.text: appearing in the doorway, topped by blonde hair and held thin bronzed arms. It's JULIE SPEER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie.   What are you doing here? He rises to help her find a spot to put the flowers. nods to the girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know we just met, but I was thinking about you guys these past few days, and I knew your mom was here. I don't know. I just felt I should stop by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember Alex. This is Scottie. Sid. This is Mrs. Speer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you friends with my mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we never met.   But I know a lot about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they now do often, Matt and Alex exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we appreciate your coming by. The flowers are lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heading to the door) Scottie, Alex. Let's go to the cafeteria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls follow Sid's prompt, leaving Matt alone with Ju standing, a dying woman between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, uh, I'm not sure how much you know about my wife's condition, but she's going to die very soon. Any minute, really. That's sort of why we're all here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. That's why I came. Because I know. I came because my husband wouldn't. And that just didn't seem right. I thought someone from my family should come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I came to your house like that. Just barged in on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right. I assume you're angry. Of course you are. I'm angry too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants     PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he told you, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After you left that night, he was acting really weird. Then I started smelling it all over him. I'd already smelled it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I finally got it out of him. We've been going crazy ever since. Not easy with the kids around. It's all something I never could have imagined. And then your family's decision about the land. I think you're doing the right thing, but Brian is -- well, it's all so complicated and confusing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian told me everything. Well, how can I ever know it's everything? When did you find out? Have you known for a while?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a few days ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm angry, but I'm just so sorry.    I can't imagine what you're going through. Do you mind if I say something to her? Matt is unsure but what else can he do?   Julie approache bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth, I'm Julie. Brian's wife. I just want to say I forgive you. I forgive you for trying to take Brian. I forgive you for almost destroying my family. I have to forgive you. Even though I want to hate you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants     PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. All right. That's enough, Julie. I think... I think that's enough. Matt walks to the door and opens it. Alex and Sid -- who' clearly had their ears against the door -- scamper away, unnoticed by Matt and Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't love her. Just so you know. He didn't really love her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I'm here. Julie heads to the door. At the door, she looks at Matt. Matt looks at her. She leaves. Matt is left alone with his wife, and he realizes suddenl that this is his moment. He walks to the bed, takes her hand, rubs his palm over h hair. He says something to her as though silently praying then realizes he should say it aloud. He presses his lips to hers and puts his hand on her stom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Elizabeth. Goodbye, my love, my friend, my pain, my joy. Goodbye. Goodbye. Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to Elizabeth's room opens, and Alexandra emerges far-away sadness on her face. She walks slowly toward --

dialogues.speaker: A NEARBY WAITING AREA
dialogues.text: -- where Matt sits with Scottie and Sid. Matt and Sid ris to comfort her, but she's not in the mood. She allows the each to hug her briefly before turning to Scottie. Signaling to Matt to let her do this, Alex escorts a fear Scottie toward Elizabeth's room, and, reassuring her, gui her little sister inside. Matt and Sid are left alone.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: To be determined. The Descendants       PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: PADDLES
dialogues.text: in the water.

dialogues.speaker: A BOX ENCIRCLED BY LEIS
dialogues.text: sits tied to the seat of a small outrigger CANOE.

dialogues.speaker: MATT AND THE GIRLS
dialogues.text: navigate the canoe through the surf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far do we have to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that far. Just past the break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steer straighter, Dad.     And a little faster, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants        PINK Shooting Draft     4/11/10 Dr

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Matt and the girls simply FLOAT, glancing from time to ti at the urn in Scottie's lap. In the distance loom the hot and high-rises of Waikiki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, here we are, just the four of us. For the last time. (then --)                                               * Alex, why don't you start? Scottie, hand her the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie does so. Alexandra takes the box reverently -- sh wants to perform this sad, strange ceremony without messi up. She opens the box and pulls out a scoop of ashes, which Scottie looks at unblinking. Alex looks to Matt, who give her the go-ahead, and without further ceremony pours them into the sea.

dialogues.speaker: THE ASHES
dialogues.text: fall densely in one spot, then slowly darken the water an disappear. Alex looks down, struck by the weirdness of it all, befor glancing up at Matt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie, you're next. Go ahead, it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex passes the box and scooper to Scottie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What should I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie looks at Alex and scoops out a pile, holds them a eye-level, and pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Scottie.    It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally)                                               * Bye, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sad Scottie pours her scoop into the water.         All as the ashes descend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants      PINK Shooting Draft     4/11/10 Draf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Scottie, here.      Pass that to me. Good job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Matt takes his turn. He looks directly inside the urn the ashes that were once his wife.

dialogues.speaker: THE ASHES
dialogues.text: A complex series of emotions passes over his face -- love grief, disappointment, resignation. Without further ceremony he upends the BOX over the water pours the rest of Elizabeth into the ocean. All three take a long look as the mass of ashes disappear Matt takes off his LEI and places it into the water. The girls follow suit. WIDE ANGLE of the boat floating as the leis float away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scottie lies on a sofa watching television, draped with t QUILT that lay atop her mother's hospital bed. Matt comes over with TWO DISHES, hands one to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One scoop strawberry, one scoop mocha chip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt gets under the quilt with her. Moments later Alexand wanders in, notices what they're watching, sits next to M pulls the quilt over her legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have some?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Descendants     PINK Shooting Draft   4/11/10 Draft

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: His eyes not leaving the TV, Matt hands Alex his ice crea As they sit there on the sofa, the CREDITS roll quietly o them.
